div.h2: Welcome to North Cow Creek School

div.div:
Announcements
LINK TO AT-HOME LEARNING SURVEY (Parents please help us out by completing this survey)
PUBLIC NOTICE A public hearing will be held by the Governing Board of the NCC District at its regular meeting on Tuesday, April 21, 2020 at 7:00 pm. The Board will consider a resolution implementing school facilities fees in accordance with Education Code Section 17620. The meeting will be located at the District Office (10619 Swede Creek Rd., Palo Cedro). In addition, due to the current Shelter in Place and COVID-19 community members may attend via ZOOM (https://northcowcreek.zoom.us/j/83662878 | Meeting ID: 836 628 781). Further information on the costs of school services and facilities and on other available revenue, including the general fund, will be available at the District office as of Tuesday, April 14. The Developer Feed Justification Study is available online by clicking HERE.
The School Board meeting will be held as normally scheduled. Parents may view the Board meeting via ZOOM (https://northcowcreek.zoom.us/j/83662878 | Meeting ID: 836 628 781).
RECENT COMMUNICATION/ANNOUNCEMENTS
We hope our families are taking this spring break week to put away the school work and relax as a family. We have no date for the return of students. We continue to be hopeful that students will be able to return prior to the end of this school year.
Beginning Tuesday, April 14, we will be moving to a hybrid (online and paper/pencil) instruction program for students. Teachers will be reaching out to their students and families with more information on what this will look like. This is a new experience for us all, and we ask for your patience and feedback as we learn together. To help accommodate the pick up of needed materials, each teacher will have a blue tub where students can pick up and return work. These tubs will be located in the fenced-in area on the south side of campus. Please make sure you only take material that have your child's name on it. To insure your child receives credit, make sure their name is on all returned materials.
Don't forget to check out our website for the most current updates as well as links to resources. On Monday, you'll begin seeing links to teacher webpages that are being used to share curriculum and resources. These will be found under the STUDENT tab at northcowcreek.org.
The Beaver Bash has been postponed and we are hopeful it can be rescheduled for May 9th.
The fundraiser for Mrs. Flaggs son, Christopher, continues. A GoFundMe campaign has been started to help his family with medical expenses. You can donate at https://gf.me/u/xrtdvq or by sending a check to NCC addressed to the EdFoundation and with Christopher Flagg written in the memo line.
Beginning Tuesday, April 14 the office will be open Monday - Thursday from 7:00 am to 11:00 am. Appointments after these times and questions or tech support can be sent to nccs@northcowcreek.org.
Need Internet Connection Resources? Click HERE to view a list of resources you can take advantage of for both free and discounted internet connections.
Congratulations to virtual field trip winners: Weve had over 85 submissions from students sharing information on their virtual field trip experience. We drew five more names of students who submitted what they learned. These students will be receiving a special school prize pack in the mail. Links to the virtual field trips are available on our school website under the STUDENT tab.
What else is happening on campus while students are away? A big thank you to our custodial staff who have been working on deep cleaning our campus while students are away. If you have driven by campus, you will also notice that the K-2 classroom wings have been re-roofed. We are also considering plans fore painting our bathrooms with murals. Anyone interested in assisting are encouraged to email nccs@northcowcreek.org.
LINK TO AT-HOME LEARNING SURVEY
NOTICE OF VACANCY AND PROVISIONAL APPOINTMENT
TO THE NORTH COW CREEK SCHOOL BOARD
A letter of resignation was filed with the Shasta County Superintendent of Schools on January 21, 2020 to be effective January 23, 2020 creating a vacancy on the North Cow Creek School District Board. In accordance with Education Code Section 5091, the North Cow Creek District Board on March 17, 2020, selected Lyndse Bullard as the provisional appointee to fill the vacancy.
Registered voters of the North Cow Creek District may submit a petition calling for a special election to fill the vacancy. Such a petition must be filed with the Shasta County Superintendent of Schools within thirty days of the date of the appointment. If no petition is filed, this provisional appointment shall be an effective appointment.
JOB OPENINGS
We are in need of substitute paraprofessionals and custodians. If you are interested, please contact/visit the school office to pick up an application.
AERIES PARENT PORTAL
Parents of students in grades 4-8 have access to the Aeries Parent Portal. The portal displays students grades and attendance. To access the portal, click the PARENT PORTAL icon to the right. Enter the parent email address on file at school followed by your password. If you have forgotten the password, click the FORGOT PASSWORD link. If you are still unable to access the portal, call the office to verify your email address.
About North Cow Creek School
NCCS is a small (260 student) school in rural Northern California, which has been in existence since 1882. Currently, over 66% of our families drive from as far away as Cottonwood, Shasta Lake City, Shingletown, and Igo/Ono to attend one of the top schools in Shasta County. NCCS's long tradition of exceptional student achievement has earned two California Distinguished School recognition, the Governor's Physical Fitness Award, and a variety of other local awards.We believe that every child is able to learn with quality instruction, time, and support. We ensure this happens by providing family centered school culture, academic support for students in reading and math, and up-to-date curriculum in all subjects. At NCCS, we're also proud to provide a full sports program, including flag football (6th-8th), basketball (4th-8th), volleyball (6th-8th), softball (6th-8th), baseball (6th-8th), track (4th-8th), and ski/snowboard (K-8th).
Support NCCS
Clicking on the links below will take you to specific sites that allow you to purchase online with a percentage of your purchase going back to the school. Most major stores are available.
Athletic Banners
Businesses can support our athletic program by purchasing a banner with their business information. These banners will be prominently displayed in the gym. More information can be found by downloading the informational flyer HERE.
